reviewText: My son loves this movie. He watches it frequently. He is a huge KD and Thunder and basketball fan. His first and middle initials are even KD (predicted that one in the womb?) He also wears his KD jersey, shorts, and socks frequently.  This is a great kids' movie about being yourself. Highly appropriate for kids, unlike many movies nowadays. I have to love KD too. He is a great role model from what I've seen, plus he's a Texas Longhorn!!! Hook 'Em!
Title: Thunderstruck

reviewText: This is a great family movie. We watched it twice, and enjoyed it both times. I recommend this movie if you are looking for a fun family movie!
Title: Thunderstruck

reviewText: Great movie. Reinforces the values of honesty and team work. Love the fact it revolves around the fact hard work matters more than talent. The only scene that is inappropriate in the entire show was a pool party some teenagers were having.

reviewText: We (42, 40 female, 17 female, 14, 12) all really enjoyed this movie.  Plot is the same as the Michael Jordan movie but better cause its the Thunder.  ;)

reviewText: This is the type of movie we have seen thousand times or so. If u ever seen like mike or like mike 2 . U have seen this movie nothing diffent. Only thing they did this time . reviewText: The movie is slow moving and mostly boring.The plot is  also boring.  It does have some good basketball action.I don't recommend this film.
Title: Thunderstruck

reviewText: Engaging tale about a high school basketball towel boy who attends NBA Thunder game and ends up with Kevin Durant's basketball skills!He goes out for the basketball team, coached by Jim Belushi and plays like a pro, getting the pretty girl along the way.  But, he gets a big head and is no fun.  Meanwhile, Durant struggles.  Durant's agent concludes the boy has Durant's skills so they try and trade back. Similar toLike Mike.  Features a quote fromHoosiers.In the end it all works out. I wondered if maybe it would not. Fun. OKC gets pub!
summary: Basketball player gets NBA game skills
Title: Thunderstruck

reviewText: We watched Thunderstruck and were totally pleased with the movief.  When I say for all ages, I am 70 and my GreatNephew is 9, and we watched the movie together.  We would watch it again.
Title: Thunderstruck

reviewText: I bought this to watch as a family because we are about to go and see an Thunder game. It is not anything original, the acting is not very good (a lot of people in the movie are not actors: basketball players), but there was very little profanity and it was funny. It was cheap and I have no regrets.
Title: Thunderstruck

reviewText: My sons 14 and 11 watched this with me and it was great.  I would recommend it as a family movie.
Title: Thunderstruck

reviewText: My grandson (14) loved it. He's very into sports, and plays, and is good at, basketball. He likes sports DVD's.
Title: Thunderstruck

reviewText: Sixteen-year old Brian (Taylor Gray) wants to be on the high school basketball team, but he has no skills. After Brian meets Kevin Durant, his game is perfected.Although I'm not very interested in basketball, I enjoyed this movie. The beginning was okay, but it became much more entertaining once Alan (Durant's Agent played by Brandon T. Jackson) figured out what happened. Jackson's performance was as funny as I expected it to be. There are also important messages for young people about friendship and 'fitting in' - I liked that.Thunderstruck is a good family film.Favorite Line: Coach, is that from Hoosiers?
Title: Thunderstruck

reviewText: this is a good family movie, even if you do not like sports.  I think everyone can relate to this film.
Title: Thunderstruck

reviewText: Very entertaining.  It's not a new concept, just a variation on a theme.  Frumpy young athlete gains magical powers and becomes a star.

reviewText: Good story, decent acting, everyone in the family enjoyed the movie from kids to adults.  I would recommend for an all around entertaining family movie.

reviewText: Cant beat a good film you can set down and watch and not worry about every other word being a curse word or something blowing up.It has life lessons that can be taken away from it and applied to everyday living.Not only does Kevin Durant play basketball he also as a pretty good acting demeanor.It has good clean comedy and or course kids being kids.A good all around popcorn flick to watch with your young ones. Not many films like that these days.If your looking for a CGI, Blow stuff up movie. This isn't for you.
Title: Thunderstruck

reviewText: The message in this movie to be true to yourself and not succumb to peer pressure was something my daughter benefited. We enjoyed this movie immensely.

reviewText: The plot to this movie is similar to the "Freaky Friday" plot, which has been used to death in other movies, but THIS movie takes it in a direction where you don't really mind that...If you like fantasies, then you will probably like this movie.

reviewText: First of all, being a Thunder fan. The movie is probably not Oscar level but a good movie for the family. You need family time and are a basketball fan(this could one of your favorite players)this is good for bonding and enjoying the basketball stuff. Giving hope and courage to step out and try on your own believing that you can achieve in life. This could be you, the now and the future.

reviewText: We rented this movie when it first came out and my son and I both like it. I ordered it as a present and he was thrilled. We have watched it many, many times and have become huge K.D. fans as well. Awesome movie!!!

reviewText: This is a good entertaining family film.  Just a feel good movie, that is a good escape from reality.  Those movies are short in supply these days, with the violent and dark Hollywood trend.  More movies like this are needed.
